channel.title: BBC News - Asia
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Afghanistan: A new order begins under the Taliban's governance
item.description: The Taliban's new ministers have taken office - but are they any different this time around?

item.title: Afghanistan: Women beaten for demanding their rights
item.description: Women in Afghanistan demanding their rights say they have been beaten by the Taliban.

item.title: Afghanistan: Could Pakistani drones hit the Panjshir Valley?
item.description: There are claims that Pakistan has used drones against anti-Taliban forces in Afghanistan.

item.title: Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte to stand as vice-president
item.description: Rivals accuse the president, barred from a second term, of seeking to cling on to power.

item.title: Olympics: IOC suspends North Korea until end of 2022 for skipping Tokyo Games
item.description: North Korea is suspended from the International Olympic Committee (IOC) until the end of 2022 after failing to send a team to the Tokyo Games.

item.title: India: One dead and many missing after boats collide in Assam
item.description: A massive rescue operation is under way in Assam to find at least 30 people still missing.

item.title: Chaos and confusion: The frenzied final hours of the Afghan government
item.description: Through interviews with insiders, BBC News has pieced together an account of how Afghanistan’s government unravelled.

item.title: Ai Weiwei: Credit Suisse closed bank account over China
item.description: The Chinese artist says Credit Suisse closed his foundation's bank account over his "criminal record".

item.title: Indonesia prison fire: Tangerang jail blaze kills 41 inmates
item.description: All of the dead, including two foreigners, were inmates, with guards unable to unlock doors in time.

item.title: Hong Kong: Tiananmen vigil organisers arrested
item.description: Members of a pro-democracy organisation have been detained under a controversial security law.

item.title: India paves way for more women in armed forces
item.description: The government says women can join military colleges and be eligible for permanent commissions.

item.title: Australia media can be sued for social media comments, court rules
item.description: A landmark court ruling finds news outlets can be sued for comments posted on their social media.

item.title: Climate change: Vulnerable nations call for 'emergency pact'
item.description: The countries at greatest risk say all nations must take bigger steps to avoid climate catastrophe.

item.title: Covid vaccine: India gave more jabs than G7 nations combined in August
item.description: The country administered 180 million doses of three approved vaccines in August.

item.title: Chinese social media site Weibo suspends 22 K-pop accounts
item.description: The social media site says 22 fan accounts have been suspended for "irrational celebrity support”.

item.title: Vietnam: Man gets five years in jail for spreading Covid
item.description: Le Van Tri was found guilty of spreading the virus to eight people in Vietnam, one of whom died.

item.title: Australian bush rescue: Mother's reunion with boy lost for four days
item.description: Three-year-old Anthony "AJ" Elfalak is recovering with family after going missing for four days.

item.title: Afghanistan: The pledge binding al-Qaeda to the Taliban
item.description: The history of the complex relationship between the two groups.

item.title: Sunil Perera: Sri Lanka's larger than life music legend dies at 68
item.description: Sunil Perera was the frontman of The Gypsies - Sri Lanka's biggest musical franchise.

item.title: What election losers tell us about Indian democracy
item.description: Thousands of parties contest Indian polls but the rising participation masks a murky underbelly.

item.title: Joe Ferrari: The high-rolling life of Thailand's controversial ex-police chief
item.description: Joe Ferrari, who is said to own 42 cars, was last month pictured torturing a suspect to death.

item.title: Saving Australian frog species on the brink of extinction
item.description: Scientists fear four species are already extinct but say urgent action can save others.

item.title: Afghanistan: What's life like since the Taliban took over?
item.description: People around the country tell the BBC they have lost basic freedoms and are struggling to survive.

item.title: Why has Australia switched tack on Covid zero?
item.description: Australia is racing to vaccinate its population ahead of a huge shift in its pandemic strategy.

item.title: Afghanistan: What rise of Taliban means for Pakistan
item.description: Some Western powers hope that Pakistan could play a role as a mediator with the new Taliban government.
